page.title: 17Gardens-Biddestone 1985
page.content: It was such a late spring that snowdrops were not in flower till March- at the same time as the daffodils. Three gardens in Little Challows and several in the Tynings had lovely displays of bulbs and white tulips were especially effective. Blossom time, also late, was marvellous; apples, pears, cherries, lilac and laburnum decked the village. Bedding plants came on very late, antirhinums and astors barely out before August but the garden at the corner of Hart's Lane and the border outside the shop were very colourful. Troughs of flowers outside houses in Cuttle Lane provided colour most of the summer and there were lovely dahlias and hollyhocks at cottages around the Green. Yellow tagates round the War Memorial were cheerful and the pubs had colourful displays.
